medical_history.chief_complaint: Liposuction and metabolic disturbances associated with familial partial lipodystrophy.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was diagnosed with diabetes at age 15 and experienced severe insulin resistance and hypertriglyceridemia leading to recurrent pancreatitis by ages 20 and 22. Her menstrual cycle became irregular at age 17 with the onset of hirsutism and the diagnosis of polycystic ovarian syndrome. Symptoms have progressively worsened, contributing to continual care and increased insulin dosage.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diagnosed with diabetes at age 15, severe hypertriglyceridemia at ages 20 and 22 due to recurrent pancreatitis, and polycystic ovarian syndrome by age 17. Hospitalized for pancreatitis twice.
medical_history.family_history: A 53-year-old father with a history of type 2 diabetes and dyslipidemia, but not clinically lipodystrophic. Mother died at age 20 from meningitis. Sister, half-sister, and two half-brothers are healthy.
medical_history.social_history: Living in the Netherlands. Not specified.
